text: Parthenay is a commune, an ancient fortified town, in the Deux-Sèvres department in the Nouvelle-Aquitaine region in western France. It is a subprefecture of the Deux-Sèvres department. It is also the capital of the arrondissement of Parthenay. == Geography == Parthenay is considered the capital of the Gâtine poitevine (or Gâtine de Parthenay), a region with bocages that is found in the central third of the department of Deux-Sèvres. It is at to the southeast of Bressuire, the other subprefecture of the department. The city is at about from Bordeaux, from Paris, from Marseille and from Toulouse. The commune has an area of . Its average altitude is ; at the city hall, the altitude is . The commune of Parthenay is surrounded by the communes: The Thouet river, a left tributary of the Loire river, flows through the city. ===Climate=== The climate of Parthenay, in the Köppen climate classification, is Cfb - Oceanic climate with template summers. ==Population== The inhabitants of Parthenay are known, in French, as Parthenaisiens (women: Parthenaisiennes). With a population of 10,367, Parthenay has a population density of inhabitants/km2. It is part of the intercommunality Parthenay-Gâtine (). === Twinned and partner towns === Parthenay is twinned with: * Manakara, Madagascar * Weinstadt, Germany * Arnedo, Spain * Abrantes, Portugal * Tsévié, Togo * Tipperary, Ireland * Edmundston, Canada ==Gallery== File:Parthenay mairie 3.JPG|Parthenay town hall.
